pageContext.description: Palstave with one loop and concave sided blade extension; stop ridge of ledge form, curving side flanges forming U-shape. A pronounced ridge along the centre of each blade face merges into chamfered edge, which is slightly damaged. casting seam on both sides. Broken off at shaft end.
pageContext.surface: Pitted surface, blackish green over greater part, but has been cleaned to show metal clearly.
pageContext.other: Length: 6.375" = 161.925 mm,Width: 2.1875" at cutting edge = 55.5625mm,Thickness: 0.875" above loop = 22.225mm; 0.5" below loop = 12.7mm,Weight: 1 lb (16 oz) = 453.592gms
pageContext.collection: Newark-on-Trent Municipal Museum,Accession no: 785-1.,Presented to the Museum by Mr. William Bradley from his collection of local antiquities. 1925.
pageContext.site: England, nottinghamshire,the spitals, northgate,found before 1920 (exact date unknown) in the area known as "the spitals", northgate, near where the fosse way crosses the eastern region main railway line. site of early mediaeval hospital of st. leonard. roman pottery and coins also found nearby.
pageContext.remarks: Antonin Banks, Curator,Compiled Sept. 1957, F. Watersy
